results.title: Gross misconduct
results.creator_credit: George Miller, David Hannay, Richard Sheffield-MacClure, David Hannan Productions, Pro Films and Underworld Productions
results.brief_description: Justin Thorn (Jimmy Smits) was a popular university professor, envied by his colleagues and desired by his students. Then one young woman’s desire proves to be too great. Jennifer Carter (Naomi Watts) develops an intense infatuation which results in an encounter that gets out of control and ultimately leads to Thorn being charged with her violent rape. Now his career, his family and his freedom are in jeopardy - but was he really the rapist? The plot twists in this explosive and controversial thriller which will mesmerise and haunt you. Co-starring Sarah Chadwick as Thorn’s suffering wife and Brendon Suhr as Carter’s maligned boyfriend.

results.title: Truly madly deeply
results.creator_credit: Anthony Minghella, Robert Cooper and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: Acclaimed British actors Juliet Stevenson and Alan Rickman star in this wonderfully moving story of love, loss and letting go. Nina lives in her rat-infested flat where she spends most of her time grieving for her dead lover, Jamie. As if in answer to her dreams, Jamie re-enters her life but Nina discovers that living in the past could mean a life without a future.

results.title: Major league (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David S. Ward, Chris Chesser, Irby Smith and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: The recently widowed, and new owner of the Cleveland Indians has a plan: field the worst team ever, watch the attendance fall, then move the franchise to glorious sun-drenched Miami. So she signs a punk-pitcher (Charlie Sheen), a gimpy-kneed womanising catcher (Tom Berenger), a third-rate third baseman (Corbin Bernsen), the outfielder Willie May Hates (Wesley Snipes) and a ‘wayout’ field of other crazy misfits. The perfect plan? maybe not, but it is the perfect ingredients for this riotous and inspiring comedy.

results.title: Tracks of glory
results.creator_credit: Marcus Cole, Damien Parer, Paul D. Barron and Barron Films
results.brief_description: Starring Cameron Daddo, Phil Morris, Robert Vaughn and Nicholas Eadie, this is a story about two men from opposite ends of the earth; and their ideals, hopes and dreams. In 1903, two men are using their talents to win themselves a place in the sun. Don Walker, a champion Australian cyclist drags himself from the depths of urban poverty to the height of glory. He is a man determined to win on his own terms. American Marshall W. “Major” Taylor, a grandson of slaves, is a dedicated professional and the first black American athlete to smash his way through the colour bar. They have everything to lose and everything to win.

results.title: Changing our minds: the story of Dr. Evelyn Hooker
results.creator_credit: Richard Schmiechen, David Haugland and Intrepid Productions
results.brief_description: This fascinating documentary is a biography of Dr. Evelyn Hooker, whose research into the psychological profile of homosexual men was instrumental in the eventual declassification of homosexuality as a mental illness. Prior to Hooker’s research homosexuals and lesbians endured a range of psychiatric treatment including lobotomies, aversion therapy and hormone injections to treat their “disease”. Hooker began her research in 1954, with encouragement from a gay colleague who convinced her that psychiatric definitions of sexuality had been under-researched. Over the next fifteen years her research convinced her that psychologically it was impossible to distinguish between heterosexual and homosexual profiles. In 1974, Hooker and other progressive psychologists - in tandem with lesbian and gay activists - succesfully petitioned the American Psychiatric Association to drop its definition of homosexuality as a pathological mental illness. This moving biography includes interviews with Hooker and archival documentation of the “underground” lesbian and homosexual communities in America during the 1950s and 1960s. “Changing Our Minds” was nominated for an Academy Award in 1993 for Best Feature Documentary. Narrated by Patrick Stewart.

results.title: Mystery train
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, Jim Stark and MTI productions
results.brief_description: Mystery Train is a trilogy of films all centering on a group of strangers who arrive in Memphis, Tennessee, a city dominated by the historical presence of rock ‘n’ roll, and in particular, the memory of Elvis Presley.

constellations_other.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_other.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Jarmusch, Jim Stark and MTI productions
results.description: Mystery Train is a trilogy of films all centering on a group of strangers who arrive in Memphis, Tennessee, a city dominated by the historical prescence of rock ‘n’ roll and in particular the memory of Elvis Presley. As in all of Jarmush’s films the pleasure is in his ability to create an identification with characters who are far from the glamorous stereotypes of traditional Hollywood cinema. But as becomes clear in the cross-cutting between the various threads of the film, each individual displays both eccentricities and talents which enable them to transcend the limitations of social roles. Youki Kudoh and Mastoshi Nagase are excellent as a hip Japanese couple making a pilgrimage to Presley’s grave and the rest of the cast are also outstanding. Excellent cameos from Clash singer Joe Strummer and a very funny wild performance by blues veteran Screamin Jay Hawkins. Narrated by Tom Waits and featuring the music of John Lurie, Roy Orbinson, the Bar Kays and Rufus Thomas.

results.title: Almost an Angel
results.creator_credit: John Cornell, Ironbark Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Australian funnyman Paul Hogan stars as a thief who’s convinced he’s an angel. Hogan is career criminal Terry Dean, who’s hit by a car while saving the life of a little girl. When Terry regains consciousness, he awakens in a place strangely like heaven, with a God who looks strangely like Charlton Heston! Terry emerges from this vision believing he’s an angel - a belief that propels him and those he encounters into some howlingly funny and heartfelt predicaments.

constellations_other.name: Divining the divine
constellations_other.description: Depicting the Almighty in paintings was frowned upon in the early 1800s in Britain, much like it has been throughout the history of cinema, according to writer Scot Hughes, who made many of these connections in a 2003 article in the Sydney Morning Herald.

results.title: Whatever happened to Baby Jane?
results.creator_credit: Robert Aldrich and Seven Arts Productions
results.brief_description: Bette Davis plays Jane Hudson, an aging alcoholic whose vauderville career as child-star “Baby Jane” has faded to obscurity. Her sister Blanche (Jane Crawford) lived in Jane’s shadow as a girl but enjoyed a successful adult career as a glamourous film star until an “accident” left her wheelchair-bound. The aging sisters live alone in a gloomy Hollywood mansion, with Jane becoming increasingly eccentric and keeping Blanche a virtual prisoner. After a series of horrific incidents, the obsessive relationship between the two draws to a sinister conclusion. Based on the novel by Henry Farrell.

results.title: Frankie and Johnny
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Nick Abdo and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: This warm romantic comedy stars Michelle Pfeiffer as Frankie, a cynical waitress who is wooed by the gentle Johnny (Al Pacino), a recently released pretty criminal who takes a job as a chef in the restaurant in which Frankie works. Set around the working class neighbourhoods of New York City, the film is an engaging comedy about the fears and difficulties involved in learning to trust another person. Terrence McNally wrote the script which is based on his acclaimed play, “Frankie and Johnny in the Clair de Lune”. One of the great joys of this film are the uniformly excellent performances. The cast includes Kate Nelligan as Frankie’s fellow waitress; Nathan Lane as her generous spirited gay flat-mate; and the under-rated Hector Helizondo as Nick, the owner of the Greek restaurant in which Frankie and Johnny work.

results.title: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
results.creator_credit: John Sturges, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Considered to be one of the best western films ever made, director John Sturges explores the relationship between two of the west’s most celebrated legends - Wyatt Earp (Burt Lancaster) and Doc Holliday (Kirk Douglas). Earp is a U.S. Marshal in Dodge City and Holliday a dentist - turned gambler - who knows how to handle a gun. When Earp saves Holliday from mob violence, the foes become friends and join forces to rid the west of the lawless Clanton gang. It all leads up to the legendary Gunfight at the O.K. Corral. Screenplay by Leon Uris. Featuring a small appearance by a very young Dennis Hopper.
